description: Demolition and rebuild of domestic garage for habitable use with extension to front and single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The proposed development cumulatively, in particular through the depth of the extension would fail to be subordinate or in keeping with architectural design of the host building and would appear as an overly bulky structure and appear out of proportion to the host dwelling when viewed from adjoining sites contrary to Havering Local Plan 2016-2031 Policies 7, 26 and 34 and the objectives of the Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

The proposed rear extension would by reason of its combined depth and footprint at the shared boundary with the attached neighbour form an intrusive and unneighbourly development as well as creating an oppressive boundary which would have an adverse effect on the amenities of adjacent occupiers contrary to Havering Local Plan 2016-2031 Policies 7, 26 and 34 and the objectives of the Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the Agent by email on the 13th April 2022.
